items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the following Classified Personnel Actions:
	 
1. Classification Changes
a. Creation of New Classifications
	 
b. Positions Established
Establishment of Admissions & Records Lead Coordinator (7ADRX0217C) in Admissions & Records at San Jose City College effective 06/13/12.
	 
Establishment of Police Communications & Records Coordinator (9COPS0229C) in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 06/13/12.
	 
c. Change to Classification Title
Classification title change from Secretary to the Chancellor to Executive Administrative Assistant to the Chancellor.
	 
2. Employment
a. New Hire
Employment of Police Dispatcher (9COPS0223C) in the Campus Police Department at the District Office effective 06/11/2.
	 
3. Change of Status
a. Working Out of Class
	 
The employee is working out of class as Administrative Secretary (7VPSA0204C) at San Jose City College effective 06/01/12 through 07/06/12.
	 
The employee is working out of class as Senior Division Administrative Assistant (7SSHU0205C) at San Jose City College effective 05/14/12 through 12/31/12.
	 
The employee is working out of class as Administrative Secretary (9IBCD0264C) at San Jose City College effective 04/01/12 through 06/30/12.
	 
b. Promotion
Promotion to Administrative Secretary (7VPAA0202C) in the office of the Vice President of Academic Affairs at San Jose City College from Senior Division Administrative Assistant (7BUS0211C) in Business and Technology at San Jose City College effective 07/01/12.
	 
c. Reclassification
Reclassification process per the CSEA Chapter 363 CBA Article 23.1 and Article 23.3 "Reclassification will be effective July 1 of the year following the reclassification request."
	 
d. Re-employment
Employee re-employed per the CSEA Chapter 363 CBA Article 22.2.1 "If the District reemploys a unit member as a permanent unit member under the provisions of this section, it shall disregard the break in the service of the unit member and classify him/her as, and restore him/her to all the rights, benefits and burdens of a permanent unit member in the class to which he/she is reinstated."
	 
4. Separation 
a. Resignation
Employee resignation effective 06/01/12.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Classified Personnel Actions as submitted.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees.  District Policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (current bid limit is $81,000) should have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $750, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of April 10, 2012 through May 9, 2012 as noted in the attached documents.

items.item_details:
San Jose City College wishes to renew the current contract originally approved by the Board on August 2011 with Saint Elizabeth's Day Home, a California nonprofit charitable public benefit corporation (hereinafter "Sub-Contractor").  San Jose City College  has found the Sub-Contractor to be able to meet the needs of the Child Development Division, California Department of Education (CDE) for state child development program services for both Toddler and Preschool care.  Also, St. Elizabeth's Day Home has prior experience as a sub-contractor operating programs funded by the Child Development Division, California Department of Education.  
	 
As the certified CDD contractor, SJCC will continue to meet the condition of its contract with the California Department of Education, Child Development Division and to adhere to the Funding Terms and Conditions (FT&C).  San Jose City College has review various potential subcontractors and found St. Elizabeth's Day Home to be the most qualified to perform services under this contract.
items.item_recommendation: A recommedation that the Board of Trustees approve the contract attached in order to sub-contract the State Department of Education Grants to St. Elizabeth's Day Home.
items.item_text: Sub-Contract for Child Care - California Dept of Education Contracts
items.item_text_raw: 8. Sub-Contract for Child Care - California Dept of Education Contracts

items.item_details:
Government Code Section 7908(c) requires each community college district to report its appropriation limit to the State Chancellor of Community Colleges at least annually.
	 
The appropriation limit must be approved by the Board of Trustees in accordance with Government Code Section 7910.
	 
After the Board of Trustees approves the appropriation limit, the GANN will be reported on the Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) to the State Chancellor of Community Colleges, which is due on October 10, 2012.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees adopt the Fiscal Year 2012-2013 Appropriation Limit (GANN) resolution.

items.item_details:
BACKGROUND: Since 2000, Workforce Institute has contracted with the City of San Jose (work2future) to provide a wide variety of job readiness workshops to Santa Clara County job seekers.   Since 2006, the Workforce Institute has delivered over 17,000 hours of job readiness (61,643 attendees) workshops at multiple locations including the three primary work2future One-Stops (Campbell, Gilroy and San Jose).  Since 2009, the Workforce Institute has provided online training to over 1,300 job seekers in an effort to equip them with the skills (high level programming, project management, accounting, entrepreneurship, etc.) they need to market themselves in this tight economic market.
	 
2011-2012 CONTRACT: On August 9, 2011, the Board of Trustees approved Workforce Institute’s $1,053,300 WIA Workshops Contract awarded by work2future - City of San Jose for FY 2011-2012.
	 
2011-2012 CONTRACT FIRST AMENDMENT: On February 14, 2012 the Board of Trustees approved a $580,000 First Amendment to the 2011-2012 WIA Workshops Contract.
	 
2011-2012 CONTRACT SECOND AMENDMENT: This Second Amendment to the 2011-2012 WIA Workshops Contract adds $257,746.00 to more accurately reflect staffing, indirect costs, and expenditures required for contracted services; and to extend the term for the CISCO workshops and related services to April 30, 2013 to accommodate the full term of the NEG grant.  All other services will terminate on June 30, 2012. 
	 
The total contract amount for 2011-2012 is $1,891,046.00.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Second Amendment to the 2011-2012 WIA Workshops Contract.
items.item_text: Workforce Institute – WIA Workshop Contract
items.item_text_raw: 10. Workforce Institute – WIA Workshop Contract

items.item_details:
Since 2005, Workforce Institute has contracted with the City of San Jose to provide WIA Youth intensive services and is being funded to continue those services for the 2012-13 program year.  Services include outreach, eligibility determination, assessment, job development/placement services, and follow-up services for youth ages 18-21 who are low income with at least one barrier to obtaining employment. Services will be delivered at the work2future Youth Training Center in San Jose and the South County One-Stop in Gilroy.
	 
Contract funding for the 2012-2013 Program Year is $460,700.00
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the 2012-2013 WIA Youth Contract
items.item_text: Workforce Institute – 2012-2013 WIA work2future Youth Contract
items.item_text_raw: 11. Workforce Institute – 2012-2013 WIA work2future Youth Contract

items.item_details:
The proposed course has been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the All-College Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate.  The rigor of the approval process assures that the course has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that it fills a clear student need not being served by existing course findings.  The new course is:
	 
PSYCH 020:  Psychology of Stress Reduction

items.item_details:
The purpose of the Tentative Budget is to obtain the Board's approval of an interim budget for the new fiscal year that will authorize the District to expend funds beginning July 1, 2012 while the Legislature deliberates and adopts a final state budget for the fiscal year. In September the Adopted Budget will be presented for board approval reflecting final legislative actions.
	 
	 
The Tentative Budget is provided as an attachment to this item and also can be accessed on the District's web site at 
http://www.sjeccd.edu/business/AdminServices/Pages/BudgetReports.aspx.

WorkForce Institute received confirmation for Work2Future that funding for the Workforce Investment Act program will be allocated for the 2012/2013 program year. The allocation allows for classified positions to be reinstated and selected layoffs to be rescinded. In addition, WorkForce was able to secure other funding to reinstate two positions. 
	 
The Chancellor recommends the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution No. 061212-3

items.item_details:
INFORMATION ITEMS 
Project Highlights 
None 
	 
Alternative Project Delivery Systems – Lease/Leaseback
In the March 13, 2012 Board meeting, various alternative project delivery methods were discussed.  These included standard Design-Bid-Build, Design-Build and Lease/Leaseback.  Further discussion of one particular method, Lease/Leaseback, is presented for consideration by the Board.
	 
Monthly Measure G-2010 Summary Report through May 31, 2012 
Attached please find the Measure G-2010 Summary Report through May 31, 2012.
	 
ACTION ITEMS 
Contracts
Master Agreement for Design Professional Services
	 
In order to consolidate and provide consistency in the terms and conditions of design professional services contracts related to Measure G-2010, a Master Agreement form was developed by the Measure G-2010 team, reviewed by counsel and has been used in previous Board agenda items related to projects in the Measure G-2010 program.   To save reproduction costs and to simplify the Board of Trustees agenda content in future approvals for design professional services, the Board is asked to formally approve the Master Agreement for Design Professional Services contract form.  In doing so it can be identified by reference and will no longer be necessary to include a copy of the Master Agreement in each relevant Board Agenda item. 
	 
Construction Contract – SJCC Synthetic Turf Replacement
	 
On January 24, 2012, the Board approved the Design Services Agreement for the San Jose City College Track & Field Replacement with Bellinger Foster Steinmetz Landscape Architecture.
	 
In May 2012, following completion of the design, the District invited bids from contractors for the San Jose City College Track & Field Replacement project.  The bid proposal also required bidders to propose prices for alternate bid items.  Pursuant to Public Contract Code Section 20103.8(b), the lowest bid was to be  the lowest total of the bid prices on the base contract and those additive or deductive items (alternates) that were specifically identified in the bid solicitation as being used for the purpose of determining the lowest bid  price.  The alternates were:
Alternate #1: Disposal of existing synthetic turf to Class-1 landfill.
Alternate #2: Provide a new track timing system.
Alternate #3: Provide a color message board in lieu of the monochrome included in the base bid.
	 
A mandatory pre-bid walk took place on May 22, 2012 and an addendum was issued on May 24, 2012.  Bids were opened on May 30, 2012 at 3 p.m. Responding firms were:
 
	 
                   
Vendor
Base Bid 
Alternate #1 
Alternate #2
Alternate #3 
Total
                          
OC Jones & Sons
$741,000.00 
$41,000.00

$796,613.00

$855,555.00 
					 
Pavex (Granite Rock Co.)
$746,916.00 
$121,575.00 
$12,000.00 
$31,870.00 
$912,361.00 
	 
The lowest apparent and responsive bidder was O.C. Jones & Sons with a bid total amount of $849,650. Following discussions with the College and the Architect it was agreed that Alternate #3 is not to be included in the contract with the bidder. As such, the Board is requested to approve award of a contract to O.C. Jones & Sons in the amount of $797,850.
	 
Vehicle Purchases
	 
The Measure G-2010 bond includes a project to replace aging and non-functioning vehicles.  As part of this project the District solicited bids for certain vehicle needs deemed immediately necessary.
	 
On April 24, 2012 and May 1, 2012, Bid Proposal #G2010.0019 – Vehicles Replacement, Group 1 Police & Industrial was advertised for the replacement of aging vehicles for the continued operation of the District.  After analyzing the bids, it is recommended that the Board approve the award to the listed vendors below.  The vehicles will be purchased through the standard District Purchase Order process.
	 
C&N Tractor – Total approval of $157,882.62 (See detail that follows)
1 each Kubota Tractor Loader Backhoe (new) for a total cost of $69,875.40.
6 each Kubota Diesel Utility Vehicle (new), at $14,667.87 each for a total cost of $88,007.25.
	 
Priority 1 Public Safety - Total approval of $133,687.70 (See detail that follows)
1 each Chevy Caprice Patrol PPV (new) for a total cost of $55,836.80.
1 each Ford Escape Community Services SUV (new) for a total cost of $28,076.81.
1 each Ford Explorer Interceptor SUV (new) for a total cost of $49,774.09.
	 
Turf and Industrial Equipment Company - Total approval of $53,421.77 (See detail that follows)
2 each Vantage Extended Cab Electric Truck (new) at $22,637.98 each for a total cost of $45,275.96.
1 each Utility Trailer (new) for a total cost of $8,145.81.
	 
Change Orders 
Impact Sciences – Environmental Impact Report
	 
During development of the draft initial Environmental Impact Report for Evergreen Valley College in support of the 2025 Facilities Master Plan, Impact Sciences determined that it would be in the best interest of the District to perform a Cultural Resources study at EVC.  This study incorporates:
	 
A report for the purpose of supporting a CEQA Initial Study/Mitigated Negative Declaration/EIR.
A records search from the Northwest Information Center, access and review aerial photographs and Sanborn Fire Insurance Maps at UC Berkeley Map Library. The fire insurance maps will be analyzed to determine likelihood of historic industrial archaeological potential.
An archaeological survey on the college parcel. If resources are located, they will be recorded on appropriate California Department of Parks and Recreation 523 forms. 
Native American and historic society consultation including contacting the Native American Heritage Commission, letters, and follow-up telephone calls.
 
In performing this study now, the need for further project-specific studies for each project identified by the 2025 FMP is minimized.  The Board is asked to approve a change order to Impact Sciences in the amount of Seven Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($7,500).
	 
EVC Photovoltaic Project - SunPower Corporation, Site Allowance Change Order 
On April 12, 2011 the Board agreed to enter into an agreement with SunPower Corporation, Systems to provide a photovoltaic solar array at Evergreen Valley College.  As a result of that approval, the District secured reservation of a PG&E CSI incentive (rebate) through January 20, 2012. The formal contract with SunPower was approved by the Board on June 14, 2011.
	 
Subsequent to these approvals, the College chose to increase the total output of the solar array system from 1.0 megawatts to 1.4 megawatts. SunPower Change Order #2, approved by the Board on September 27, 2011 increased the contract amount to $8,391,313 and subsequently the rebate was extended to July 18, 2012.  On January 24, 2012 the Board approved time extensions to SunPower that set Substantial Completion at March 20, 2012 and Final Completion at June 13, 2012.
	 
During the course of construction the project incurred additional costs, and coordination with PG&E has affected the schedule.  In accordance with the attached detailed analysis of these changes, the Board is asked to approve SunPower Change Order #003 in the amount of $185,255, increasing the contract value to $8,576,568 and to change the Substantial Completion Date to May 17, 2012 as well as the Final Completion Date to October 29, 2012.
	 
Bond List Revisions 
Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #2
	 
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2010 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2010 individual project names, scopes and budgets.  This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list. 
	 
Bond List Revision #2 reflects the collaborative efforts by the Bond Management Team to plan and prioritize Measure G-2010 Bond projects at San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College.  The project revisions included in this Bond List Revision address project consolidations to gain efficiency and economy of scale and incorporate additional funding in the form of interest earned on bond funds.  These revisions are the result of careful coordination and realignment with the current Facilities Master Plans and the planned implementation of the projects at each campus. 
	 
Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #2 includes the following project revisions:
	 
San Jose City College Project List Revisions:
Project 31107 - Theater, Drama & Speech Building:
Scope and budget from Project 31113 - Vocational Technology Building is being transferred to this project to gain efficiency and economy of scale.  The new name for this combined project will be “Project 31107 - Theater & Vocational Technology”.  
Project 31113 - Vocational Technology Building:
The scope and budget for this project is being combined with project 31107 - Theater, Drama & Speech Building to gain efficiency and economy of scale.  The new name for this combined project will be “Project 31107 - Theater & Vocational Technology”.  
Project 31114 - Demo 300:
The scope of this project is being expanded to include the demolition of the Auxiliary Gym, Pool and Locker Rooms. Budget in the amount of $496,117 is being transferred from Project 31116 - Campus Site Improvements to fund the cost of the additional scope of work. The new name for this project will be “Project 31114 - Demo 300, Aux Gym, Pool and Locker Room”.
Project 31116 - Campus Site Improvements:
Budget in the amount of $496,117 is being transferred to “Project 31114 - Demo 300, Aux Gym, Pool and Locker Room” to fund the cost of additional scope.
Project 39905 - Management and Related Costs related (3% of construction hard costs):
The location codes for SJCC and EVC are being consolidated to the District location for management efficiency.
Project 39999 - Election/Legal/EIR/DO Labor and related (3% of construction hard costs):
The location codes for SJCC and EVC are being consolidated to the District location for management efficiency.
Project 31199 - Campus Contingency
This additional funding reflects the Q3 Interest Allocation based on agreement between the Colleges and the District.
	 
Evergreen Valley College Project List Revisions
Project 32107 - Science/Math Building(s):
Scope and budget from Project 32112 - GED 4 and Project 32702 - IT & Tech Equipment is being transferred to this project to gain efficiency and economy of scale.  The new name for this combined project will be “Project 32107 - South Campus Development”.
Project 32112 - GED 4:
The scope and budget for this project is being combined with project 32107 - Science/Math Building(s) to gain efficiency and economy of scale. The new name for this combined project will be “Project 32107 - South Campus Development”.
Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements:
A portion of the scope and budget for this project in the amount of $290,942 is being transferred to Project 32306 - Central Plant & Police Renovation.
Project 32306 - Central Plant - Remodel:
Partial scope and budget from Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements and Project 32308 - Utilities Projects and Upgrades are being transferred to Project 32306 - Central Plant - Remodel to gain efficiency and economy of scale.  The new name for this project will be “Project 32306 - Central Plant & Police Renovation”.
Project 32308 - Utilities Projects & Upgrades:
A portion of the scope and budget in the amount of $2,523,902 is being transferred to “Project 32306 - Central Plant & Police Renovation”.
Project 32702 - IT & Tech Equipment:
Scope and budget in the amount of $4,930,430 are being transferred to Project 32107 - South Campus Development to gain efficiency and economy of scale.
Project 39905 - Management and Related Costs related (3% of construction hard costs):
The location codes for SJCC and EVC are being consolidated to the District location for management efficiency.
Project 39999 - Election/Legal/EIR/DO Labor and related (3% of construction hard costs):
The location codes for SJCC and EVC are being consolidated to the District location for management efficiency.

This additional funding reflects the Q3 Interest Allocation based on agreement between the Colleges and the District.
	 
	 
District Project List Revisions:

items.item_text_raw: 7. Measure G-2010 Bond Program Updates, Highlights, Summary Reports, Contracts, and Project Assignment Amendments

items.item_details:
Bond List Revisions 
	 
In February 2012, the Board of Trustees reviewed and approved the Measure G 2004 Bond List Revision. As stated at that time, Bond List revisions will be presented to the Board on a quarterly basis and as needed.  The Board is asked to approve a bond list revision for adjustments to three Evergreen Valley College projects under Measure G-2004 as follows:
	 
Project - Health/Physical Education Center:
Scope and budget ($4,227,778) from Project “Health/Physical Education Center” is being transferred to Project “Furniture & Equipment” to reflect the shift of this work to Measure G-2010 – “South Campus Development” to gain efficiency and economy of scale, and to allow sufficient funding in Measure G-2004 to address technology and equipment needs.
Project – Utilities Infrastructure:
A portion of the scope and budget ($702,615) for Project “Utilities Infrastructure” is being transferred to Project “Furniture & Equipment” to reflect the shift of a portion of this project to Measure G-2010 – “South Campus Development” to gain efficiency and economy of scale, and to allow sufficient funding in Measure G-2004 to address technology and equipment needs.
Project Furniture & Equipment:
A total of $4,930,394 is being transferred into this project, comprised of funds from Project “Health/Physical Education Center” and from Project “Utilities Infrastructure”, to reflect the shift of work to Measure G-2010 – “South Campus Development” to gain efficiency and economy of scale, and to allow sufficient funding in Measure G-2004 to address technology and equipment needs.
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the Evergreen Valley College Vice President of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the budget revisions and project realignment as detailed in the Measure G-2004 Bond Project List.

items.item_details:
In January 2012, the Board approved the Design Services Agreement for the Evergreen Valley College Field Replacement with Bellinger Foster Steinmetz Landscape Architecture.
	 
In May 2012, following completion of the design, the District invited bids from contractors for the Evergreen Valley College Field Replacement project. The bid proposal also required bidders to propose prices for alternate bid items. Pursuant to Public Contract Code Section 20103.8(b), the lowest responsible bid was to be the lowest total of the bid prices on the base contract and those additive or deductive items (alternates) that were specifically identified in the bid solicitation as being used for the purpose of determining the lowest bid  price. The alternates were:
Alternate #1: Disposal of existing synthetic turf to Class-1 landfill.
Alternate #2: Provide a performance pad underneath the new synthetic turf.
A mandatory pre-bid walk took place on May 22, 2012 and an addendum was issued on May 24, 2012. Bids were opened on May 30, 2012 at 3 p.m. Responding firms were:
	 
Vendor
Base Bid Amount
Alternate #1 Amount
Alternate #2 Amount
Total
Park West Landscape
$551,575.00
$9,435.00
$134,100.00
$695,110.00
OC Jones & Sons
$539,500.00
$58,000.00
$137,600.00
$735,100.00
Pavex  (Granite Rock Co.)
$538,536.00
$174,375.00
$110,791.00
$823,702.00
	 
The lowest apparent and responsive bidder was Park West Landscape with a bid total amount of $695,110. Following discussions with the College and the Architect it was agreed that both alternates should be accepted. As such, the contract amount for the Evergreen Valley College Field Replacement Project shall be in the amount of $695,110.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the award of the contract for the construction of the Evergreen Valley College Field Replacement project to Park West Landscape Construction in the amount of $695,110.

items.item_details:
The District successfully passed Measure G-2010 on November 2, 2010.  On January 25, 2011 a facilities and bonds study session served as an opportunity to share a framework for success for Measure G-2010.  Included in this framework was the recommendation that the District utilize a program and construction management firm to provide program and construction management services to the colleges and District to support implementation of various construction and deferred maintenance projects.  In keeping with the District’s desire to promote accountability, efficiency and cost effectiveness, the District went through a formal Request for Qualifications process to seek the services of a Program and Construction Management firm to provide system-wide coordination and oversight of all capital improvement work performed under the Measure G-2010 bond program.  Gilbane Building Company was selected through this process. 
	 
The initial one-year contract with Gilbane Building Company included program mobilization, scheduling, strategic program planning for implementation and design, and general program support at the campuses and the District.  The first year contract was for time and materials only at a not-to-exceed amount of $2,166,832 with the option to renew the agreement annually through 2018.  The Board of Trustees approved the contract at the May 10, 2011 Board of Trustees meeting.  On May 8, 2012 the Board approved Amendment #1 to extend the contract from May through June, 2012 at no additional cost.  Even with this added duration Gilbane’s services will come in under the original budget for the first year. 
	 
At the May 22, 2012 Board meeting Gilbane presented a detailed description of activities and accomplishments from the current contract and outlined plans and actions for the second year (FY2012/13).  
	 
The Board is asked to approve the second year (FY2012/13) contract renewal with Gilbane Building Company in the amount of $4,646,050.  Overall the Program Management budget for the life of the bond program has been established at 3% of the construction budget.  Approval of the second year agreement stays within this 3% allocation (see attached Program Management Graph).  Overall the Construction Management budget for the life of the bond program has been established at 9% of the construction budget.  Approval of the second year agreement stays within this 9% allocation (see attached Construction Management Graph).
	 
Reference the attached detailed original Program Management/Construction Management contract and Amendment #2.  Note that the basic services and contract terms and conditions remain unchanged.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the renewal of Gilbane Building Company’s Measure G-2010 Program/Construction Management (PM/CM) Services contract for fiscal year 2012/2013.

items.item_details:
The University of Phoenix (UOPX) is a for-profit institution of higher learning. UOPX is the nation’s largest regionally accredited private university.  It has more than 200 campuses worldwide and confers degrees in over 100 degree programs at the associate, bachelor’s, master’s and doctoral levels.  
	 
This MOU establishes a partnership between EVC and UOPX to create opportunities for students beyond our institution in the areas of articulation and transfer. 
	 
UOPX will accept lower division general education coursework earned at EVC and create a Course Transfer Guide to demonstrate how the student’s coursework is designated by UOPX.
	 
UOPX will identify Transfer Pathways to see how transfer credits apply on a program-to-program basis as credits earned from an associate’s degree transfer into UOPX bachelor’s degree.
	 
Students entering a bachelor’s degree program who obtained an associate’s degree from EVC will receive a 5% tuition reduction and a 100% fee waiver for the Prior Learning Assessment.
	 
In addition to the opportunities for students, UOPX is extending a 5% tuition reduction to staff and faculty who enter into a bachelor’s or higher degree program with UOPX.
	 
Either party may terminate the MOU upon thirty (30) days prior written notice.
items.item_text: Memorandum of Understanding - University of Phoenix and Evergreen Valley College - 1st Reading

items.item_details: The San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation established by the Board of Trustees has begun to build a platform upon which to enhance the district's image and strengthen critical resource development avenues. On August 16, 2012, the Foundation is hosting its first fundraising event, “Bridge To The Future” at the San Jose Athletic Club’s Corinthian Grand Ballroom.  This event features a keynote address by noted Silicon Valley Leader Carl Guardino, CEO of the Silicon Valley Leadership Group and host of the CEO Show on KLIV, and our own Chancellor Rita Cepeda.  Vice Chancellor Carol Coen, and Foundation Director Heather Saito will provide information about the event, messaging to the community, and the opportunity for Board of Trustee involvement and participation.

items.item_details:
As part of our goal to review 20% of our board policies each year, Chapter 5 (Student Services) is being submitted as a DRAFT for review.   It is being submitted as DRAFT for review at this time to keep on schedule with the approval timeline.   
	 
SJCC Academic Senate Exec Team will hold a special meeting on June 18th to review this Chapter.  If they have recommended edits/changes, it will be reflected in the following Board Meeting Agenda.  
	 
NOTE:  The accompanying document "2012 Chapter 5 Revised Sections" is a one-page document that lists the sections that have been changed since the last BOT approval.
